definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for

sentences.english: And joint state-private ownership was one way led to the goal.
sentences.chinese: “公私合营”即是达成这个任务的一种手段。

sentences.english: After the founding in 1953, Donglai bank into public-private partnership, Qingdao Branch.
sentences.chinese: 建国后1953年，东莱银行并入公私合营青岛分行。

sentences.english: It is a state-run enterprise set up in 1956.
sentences.chinese: 阳市酱油厂是1956年公私合营时组建的国营企业。

sentences.english: In a joint state-private enterprise, the private owner is more active as an operator.
sentences.chinese: 公私合营企业中，私方作为企业的操作者更具主动性。

sentences.english: In 1954 our firm became a joint state-privately operated one.
sentences.chinese: 1954年，我们公司改为公私合营了。

sentences.english: The PPIP program specifically allows for foreign sources of investment.
sentences.chinese: 公私合营投资计划尤其为海外投资者打开了大门。

definition: after liberation (i.e. after the Communist's victory)/after the establishment of PRC in 1949
state monopoly of purchasing and marketing
collectivization of agriculture (disastrous policy of communist Russia around 1930 and China in the 1950s)
fixing of farm output quotas for each household
land reform/same as 土地改革[tu3 di4 gai3 ge2]
to nationalize/to take over as communal property

pinyin: nong2 ye4 sheng1 chan3 he2 zuo4 she4
